column2: Document Title: ITP-231-CIV-FRMS- Type A Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Type A Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Tisala
Reference - Section 204.04 b) Table 204.041 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Type A material shall comply with the requirements of Table 204.041 and shall be free of topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter.
Frequency - Once, for each material type
Verifying Documents - Supplier Material Conformance Certificate
Acceptance Criteria - Areas upon which fills are to be constructed shall be prepared for test rolling by the Contractor.
○ The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Nominated Authority.
○ No fill shall be placed against or within 3 m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Nominated Authority
Frequency - Prior to commencement of fill works
Acceptance Criteria - Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
○ ATTACH: LOT MARKED UP LOCATION ON THE IFC DRAWING (LOT MAP)
Frequency - Each lot prior to commencement
Verifying Documents - Signed ITP, Lot Map
Acceptance Criteria - Type A material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding a compacted thickness of 200 mm.
Acceptance Criteria - Each Layer shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173. Where site access is restricted, verify with a pickaxe drop or similar, at the Nominated Authorities discretion.
Acceptance Criteria - Testing as per 204. Ensure testing is tracked and reports available.
— For work to be tested for compliance with Scale A or Scale B compaction requirements, the number of tests per test lot shall be six.
— For work to be tested for compliance with Scale C compaction requirements, the number of tests per test lot shall be three.
○ Lot size - the leser of one day's production or 5,000sqm
Frequency - Test the first 3 lots. Reduced min. frequency every 2nd lot of like material and work
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Compaction Test Report

Acceptance Criteria - The top of the Type A material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03 (g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water).
Reference - Table 204,041, Table 204.141 Section 204.14 a) or b)
Acceptance Criteria - Material Properties (Not Applicable for Scale C):
— 1 Lot Test to determine: Assigned CBR and swell, Grading & Max. Particle Dimension, PI and PIx%Passing 0.425mm and permeability.
— Where the first lot passes, no further testing required except where changes to the physical properties of the material are observed.
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Material Property Test Report
Acceptance Criteria - The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
— Where Scale C is nominated, random levelling is not required; however no point on the subgrade surface shall be more than 10 mm above or 30 mm below the specified level.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Survey Conformance Report
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
